roleset.name: search
roleset.note: RACK-V NOTES: Based on search-35.2. (from rack.02-v predicate notes)

example.name: rack one's brain
example.text: I racked my brain for hours trying to recall her name.

roleset.name: rapid gait of horse, wherein each foot strikes separately
roleset.note: RACK-N NOTES: Roleset based on WordNet eventive noun entries. No corresponding verb entry or VN entry, no FrameNet. Framed by Claire. (from rack.01-n)

roles.note: Only verbal examples with arg0: "I trotted, slow gait and racked the horse, both ways." (from rack.01-n)

example.name: horse arg1
example.text: They're judged by how the rack of the horse has been developed.

roleset.name: get, acquire
roleset.note: RACK_UP-V NOTES: Higher args are theoretically possible but unlikely, to my ear. (from rack.01-v)

example.name: just transitive
example.text: Toyota's $35,000 Lexus automobile, a luxury model that it started shipping to the U.S. only last month, is racking up orders at a time when U.S.-made luxury-car sales are slow.
example.arg: Toyota's $35,000 Lexus automobile, a luxury model that it started shipping to the U.S. only last month,
at a time when U.S.-made luxury-car sales are slow
